at its birth—and at nine months it is a child one has felt move inside
one’s  body—is  underestimated  both  by  anti-choice  partisans  and  by
those  for  whom  access  to  adoptable  children  is  important.  This  grief
should not be forced on any woman—or, indeed, encouraged by public
policy” (84).
f.   “We  must  be  realistic  about  the  impact  on  society  of  millions  of  un-
